This is a medium-sized city that sits on Hwy 20 between Ho Chi Minh and Dalat. This serves as a good resting stop if traveling on motorbike with many cafes and hotels with free Wi-Fi.

The park in the middle of city is quite nice. There's a lake (hồ Bao Loc) in the centre - a common place for locals to spend their weekend fishing. This makes a nice photo with the lake in the front and Vietnamese apartments (and a temple) in the back.
There's not much to do other than eat, sleep, and enjoy the little park.
There's a very popular vegetarian restaurant on Hwy 20 (aka Tran Phu) and Nguyen Van Troi, called Quan Chay (or Quan Che on Google Maps).
There are many hotels near the park and the lake (hồ Bao Loc).

value: content=Good sized rooms. Clean bed and washroom. Allows parking (motorbike) inside the hotel.

Take Highway 20 to Dalat (north) or Ho Chi Minh City (south).
